content: The Smithsonian brings seriously good quality museum materials in an exciting way for youngsters for free - what isn't excellent about that.
You must go could spend all day here and still not see everything. Wife and I had fun will come back as soon as kids get older!
Went on a guided tour...Guide was Charlie. SO knowledgeable and interesting that I didn't want the tour to end.

We went to the air and space museum yesterday. It is a great free place which holds a lot if history and knowledge. I did notice that many of the interactive areas were not working correctly and it was super crowded so we left without seeing everything. If you can make it during the week I would suggest doing so....

The impressive sight of so many airplanes and space satellites, as well as special cars for the moon, even for a non airplane fan as me, made this museum a quite a place to think about air and space. If you are in Washington, go there. This is one of the must places in the city.

Both the exhibits and the actual old planes and flying machines here are fantastic and on their own make visiting worthwhile, together they provide a proper history of flight and space travel. Loads to see, so plan on spending at least an hour or two here.

where else can you touch a rock from Mars?
I found some of the most interesting things to be captions and photos. Yes, the hardware is amazing, but soem of the history blows you away. Check out the photos of the B-52's that were hit by shells, and still flew home...

Of all the museums, this may be what you most remember. America's (and some others) experience with airplanes and space is here. And they have the iconic aircraft - the real ones. Allow time to view the videos. Also - if you like this at all - you will want to go to their other location near Dulles where they...
If you like Air and Space, also go to their second location in Chantilly, VA. Not a long drive. Has LOTS more stuff: The Enola Gay, The Concord, Space Shuttle...

We got to the museum right when it opened at 10am. The museum had an information desk and the gentleman recommended the tour to start. I usually wouldn't do a tour but since the place is huge and we didn't really know where to start we thought we'd try it. All the tour guides were senior citizens and completely fabulous!...
